thread.title: Furious Marine Le Pen accuses European fraud team of double standards | World | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: Furious Marine Le Pen accuses European fraud team of double standards | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Simon Osborne
title: Furious Marine Le Pen accuses European fraud team of double standards | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Firebrand French far-right leader Marine Le Pen is furious at an EU probe A good illustration of these hate-filled, pathetic socialists who are so predictable across Europe Marine Le Pen 
At the same time, OLAF was already involved in another investigation of Mrs Le Pen which concluded she violated European Parliament rules by having two of her assistants — Thierry Légier and Catherine Griset — carry out non-parliamentary work while on its payroll. 
Ms Le Pen was told to repay the Parliament £285,000, which she has yet to do. 
At the time she described Mr Schulz as “a good illustration of these hate-filled, pathetic socialists who are so predictable across Europe” and suggested he carried out his own inquiry into Mr Hansen. 
Mrs Le Pen’s lawyer Marcel Ceccaldi alleges that OLAF used 'double standards' when investigating the two cases. 
And she now claims OLAF acted as a tool of Mr Schulz to undermine her and her party and has filed a lawsuit against OLAF and its director-general, Giovanni Kessler. GETTY Marine Le Pen and prominent Front National member Gilbert Collard 
Mr Kessler insisted his agency was above the political fray and said the same methods had been used to investigate the claims about Mr Hansen as those about Mrs Le Pen’s assistants. 
He told politico.eu: “OLAF has conducted thorough, objective and independent investigations, revealing documented evidence. 
“While we used the same investigative methods, principles and tools in both cases, the investigations revealed very different facts. GETTY Marine Le Pen is flying high in the opinion polls Things you didn't know about Marine Le Pen Mon, February 20, 2017 Marine Le Pen is a French politician who is the president of the National Front, a national-conservative political party in France and one of its main political forces. AFP/Getty Images 1 of 10 Described as more democratic and republican than her nationalist father, she has led a movement of "de-demonization of the Front National" to detoxify it and soften its image 
“In one case, we uncovered serious irregularities that are detrimental to the EU budget while in the other case we did not.” 
The latest OLAF investigation and the parallel probe by French authorities were launched after Mr Schulz notified officials in Paris and Brussels that 20 parliamentary assistants hired by the Front National also held official positions within the party organisation, potentially drawing a double salary and contravening EU rules. 
Both the French and the OLAF investigations into the Front National’s use of assistants are ongoing. Related articles
